_header: Jesu my sweet which that all thing has wrought
_description: A prayer for purity of thought — one monorhyming 4-line stanza in John Grimestone’s preaching notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Iesu my swete wich þat alle þingge hast wrouthþat come
                    fro heueue lith & hast me dere bouthþu ȝeue me wil & mith
                    to ben clene in þouthTo kepen þe o rith þat i ne senne nouth
                    Amen
NLS18721.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Popular Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         36 (1939): 337-50: 345.
